Amounts in this report have been rounded off in accordance with Corporations Instrument 2016/191 to the nearest thousand dollars, or in certain cases, the nearest dollar.
This report is made in accordance with a resolution of Directors, pursuant to section 298(2) (a) of the Corporations Act 2001.
BDO Audit Pty Ltd continues in office in accordance with section 327 of the Corporations Act 2001.
A copy of the auditor’s independence declaration as required under section 307C of the Corporations Act 2001 is set out immediately after this Director’s report.

The attached financial statements and notes comply with the Corporations Act 2001, Australian Accounting Standards, Corporations Regulations 2001, and other mandatory professional reporting requirements.
The attached financial statements and notes comply with International Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.
The attached financial statements and notes give a true and fair view of the Consolidated Entity's financial position as of 3 July 2022 and performance for the year ended on that date.
There are reasonable grounds to believe that the Company will be able to pay its debts as and when they become due and payable.
At the date of this declaration, there are reasonable grounds to believe that members of the Extended Closed Group will meet any obligations or liabilities as detailed in the deed of cross guarantee.
The Company complies with ASX Corporate Governance Principles and Recommendations.

data.value: This is an artistic architectural photograph showing a pier or boardwalk structure extending over water. The image appears to be taken from a low angle, showing the concrete pillars and white railings of the structure stretching into the distance with a minimalist, blurred aesthetic. A distant figure can be seen on the walkway.

The image appears to be a fashion or lifestyle product photograph showing a casual summer outfit. The outfit consists of a sage green t-shirt with a side knot detail, paired with white pants. The model is wearing a wide-brim straw hat and gold necklace accessories. The photo is taken outdoors with some architectural elements visible in the background, including what appears to be a metal railing or fence. The styling and composition suggest this is a commercial product photograph, likely for a clothing retailer or fashion brand's marketing materials.

This appears to be a fashion advertisement or marketing image for Mosaic Brands. The image shows a fashion model wearing a black and white houndstooth pattern dress with long sleeves and a wrap-style design. The model is also wearing clear-framed glasses and beige boots. The photo is taken against a beige/tan architectural background with visible pipes or columns. At the bottom of the image, there are several retail brand logos including Millers, Noni B, W.Lane, Katies, Rockmans, Crossroads, Autograph, Beme, and EziBuy, suggesting this is part of a larger retail group's marketing materials.

data.value: All new or amended Accounting Standards and Interpretations issued by the Australian Accounting Standards Board ('AASB') that are mandatory for the current reporting period have been adopted.
The consolidated financial statements incorporate the assets and liabilities of all subsidiaries of Mosaic Brands Limited as at 3 July 2022.
Financial assets and financial liabilities are initially measured at fair value and subsequently measured at amortised cost or fair value depending on their classification.
Fair value reflects the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants.
The consolidated entity recognises a loss allowance for expected credit losses on debt instruments measured at amortised cost or fair value through OCI.
The financial statement disclosures cover accounting treatments related to factors such as lease liabilities, right-of-use assets, and impacts from COVID-19.
Recognised at lease commencement, measured at cost, depreciated over the lease term or estimated useful life.
Recognised at the present value of lease payments, classified as current or non-current based on expected settlement.
Recognised when there is reasonable assurance of compliance with conditions and receipt of funds.
Certain amounts were reclassified in the financial report for consistency with current year presentation.
